page.title: 14CHANGES IN BRINSWORTH
page.content: {Mr. Bellamy,}our{caretaker}talked to us about his memories of Brinsworth. {Brinsworth}was one of the first villages to have{gas lighting. Gas} was piped from{coke ovens.}Mr. Bellamy said{tourists}used to come and see the lights. Very few people lived here. Most of the men worked{down the pit}or for the railways. The{Railway Sheds}were opened in{1900. Thick smoke}hung over the village on a{Sunday evening}when the engines were being{stoked.}The sheds have gone now and{Barratt's}are building a new estate there. Most of us live on the{White Hill Lane}estate. It was started in{1970.} { Mr. Bellamy}said the{dentist}used to come to{school}to see to his teeth. {Adele's Mum}showed us a book about { {Brinsworth}in{Coronation Year 1953.}It is very different now.{
